markdown:
# Reaction

Certain special abilities, spells, and situations allow you to take a special action called a reaction. A reaction is an instant response to a trigger of some kind, which can occur on your turn or on someone else's.

## Rules

- You can take only **one** reaction per round of combat
- When you take a reaction, you can't take another one until the start of your next turn
- If the reaction interrupts another creature's turn, that creature can continue its turn right after the reaction

## Common Reactions

### Opportunity Attack
The most common reaction is an [[opportunity_attack]]. When a hostile creature you can see moves out of your reach, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack against that creature.

### Spells
Some spells can be cast as a reaction. The spell description tells you the trigger for the reaction:
- *Shield*: Cast when you're hit by an attack
- *Counterspell*: Cast when you see a creature casting a spell
- *Feather Fall*: Cast when you or a creature within range falls
- *Hellish Rebuke*: Cast when you take damage from a creature you can see

### Class Features
Many class features use reactions:
- **Uncanny Dodge** (Rogue): Halve the damage from an attack
- **Deflect Missiles** (Monk): Reduce ranged weapon attack damage
- **Riposte** (Battle Master Fighter): Attack a creature that misses you
